block-definition.s: Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.s: wait for word embeddings to be ready

custom-block.s: speak %s then %cmdRing with pitch %n with rate %n with voice %n with volume %n in language %txt

block.l: Click the green flag for more!

block-definition.s: Load script %'URL' then %'do when loaded' even if already loaded %'reload'
Listen for %'duration' seconds then %'handle response' but if error %'handle error'
speak %'message' then %'what to do when finished' with pitch %'pitch' with rate %'rate' with voice %'voice' with volume %'volume' in language %'language code'
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide a script to run when finished, the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voices'), volume (a positive number), and language code (a BCP 47 language tag, e.g. en-US).

When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'.

custom-block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again..

block-definition.s: Listen then %'handle response' but if error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Current image property from %'cloud provider' get %'property name or names'
block-definition.comment: Reports a property of the most recent recognition by the AI cloud provider. Visit tinyurl.com/snap-ai-docs to learn more.

input.options: Google Microsoft IBM Watson

block-definition.s: speak with random settings %'message' and then %'what to do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Says 'message' with random pitch, rate, and voice.

custom-block.s: Speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br when finished do %cmdRing %br wait %b before doing the next command

block-definition.s: Speak (using Mary TTS) %'message' with voice %'voice number' at %'volume' volume %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice number'. 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. If provided will run the blocks in 'do when finished' when speech has completed.
Reports the confidence scores for the list reported by 'IBM Watson classes'.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle response' but if nothing heard %'handle nothing said' (requires Microsoft speech key)
block-definition.comment: As speech is recognised 'respond as heard' is called with what it thinks it has heard. 'handle response' is called when it thinks the speaking is finished.

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle response' but if nothing heard %'handle nothing said'
listen for a number %'what to do with the number' %'what to do if not a number'

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message

block.var: what to do with the number
what to do if not a number
what to do if not a number

block-definition.comment: Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to say what it sees then %'then receive response' and show the picture %'show photo?'

block-definition.comment: Takes a picture and runs script with a list of tags returned by Microsoft. Optionally can show the image.

block-definition.comment: Adds the photo taken when the AI cloud provider was last asked to reocognize. Photo is added as a costume of the current sprite.

input.options: Google Microsoft IBM Watson

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice number' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl when finished do %'do when finished' with the message $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice number'. 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. If provided will run the blocks in 'do when finished' when speech has completed. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.

block-definition.s: Get Mary TTS voice name %'voice number'
Speak with random voice %'message' then %'do when finished'

Listen to the microphone $nl %'respond as heard' as words are recognised $nl %'handle final response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message $nl with language %'language' $nl with %'max alternatives' maximum number of alternatives $nl %'handle alternatives' with the list of alternative recognitions $nl %'handle confidences' with the list of confidences
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be its code or name. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle final response' but if error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'.

block-definition.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %'report'
block-definition.comment: When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'. Optionally reports errors. The 'stop speech recognition' block will stop the listening as will silence that triggers a 'no-speech' error.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.comment: Reports the labels describing the most recent image recognised by the specified vision service provider.

input.options: Google Microsoft Watson

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what %'provider' sees $nl and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture. When the AI vision provider responds runs the blocks on the labels in the response. Can optionally display the photo.

input.options: Google Microsoft Watson

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks the AI vision cloud provider to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

input.options: Google Microsoft Watson

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what %txt sees %br and show the photo %b

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores for each of the labels described in the vision service provider's most recent response.

input.options: Google Microsoft Watson

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.s: Image label confidences %'costume number' then %'process response'
block-definition.comment: The costume is analysed and the label confidence scores passed to "process response". The confidences are in the same order as the labels provided to the 'Train using camera ...' block.

block-definition.s: Send photo from camera then $nl %'process confidences' $nl with the list of label confidences
block-definition.comment: Using the current training reports how confident the system is that what is in front of the camera is each of the bucket names provided in the call of "Train using camera ..."

block-definition.s: Analyse costume number %'costume number' then $nl %'process response' $nl with the list of label confidences
block-definition.comment: The costume of the current sprite is analysed and the label confidence scores passed to "process response". The confidences are in the same order as the labels provided to the 'Train using camera ...' block.

block-definition.s: Train with all my costumes with label %'label'
block-definition.comment: Send all the costumes of this sprite off to the training tab with the specified label.

custom-block.s: Add costume %obj %br to the training with label %txt %br then %cmdRing with the response

block-definition.comment: Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

block-definition.s: read URL %'URL' then %'receive contents' or if error %'receive error' using an access key if needed %'key' in JSON format %'JSON'
block-definition.comment: Reads the contents of 'URL' and then calls 'receive contents' with that text (in HTML). If there was an error 'receive error' is called instead. 'key' needs only be provided if the URL requires as access key. if JSON is true then the contents of the URL are treated as JSON code and a corresponding list of lists to the JSON is passed to "receive contents".

block-definition.s: Ask Wikipedia about %'search words' $nl then %'process response' with list of matches $nl but if error %'process error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Searches Wikipedia for 'search words' and then passes the list of results to 'process response'.

custom-block.s: read URL %txt then %cmdRing or if error %cmdRing using an access key if needed %txt in JSON format %b

block-definition.s: Display dialog box %'title' %'message' then %'do after user clicks ok'
block-definition.comment: Displays message with title. Optionally runs 'do after user clicks ok'.

block-definition.s: Train with audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap!

block-definition.s: Audio label confidences (without tensorflow) %'process confidences' of what is heard in the next %'duration' seconds
block-definition.comment: Compares what is heard in the next 'duration' seconds to the categories trained using 'Train with audio buckets ..."

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl when finished do %'what to do when finished' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voices'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. And a script to run when finished, This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

block-definition.s: map %'reporter' on each element of %'list 1' and %'list 2'
block-definition.comment: Reports a list created by applying reporter to corresponding elements of the lists.

custom-block.s: map %repRing on each element of %l and %l
map %repRing on each element of %l and %l

block-definition.s: square of distance from features %'features 1' to %'features 2'

block-definition.comment: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosine_similarity
Reports the sum of the product of corresponding elements of the lists. See "slow dot product" for a more elegant way of programming this. And "js dot product" for a fast JavaScript version.

list.l: Can only compute dot product of lists of the same length. The first one is

block-definition.s: Snap! version of closest word to %'target features' except %'exceptions' and report progress %'report progress'
block-definition.comment: See "closest word to ..." that is much much faster.

custom-block.s: all words in language %txt with features

list.l: is the best match so far after looking at

custom-block.s: square of distance from features %l to %l

scripts.comment: Can be used to replace square of distance....

block-definition.comment: Slow but elegant way of computing distance. "square of distance from features ..." is much faster.

Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
when words to features in language %'language' then %'do when loaded' $nl use this URL instead of default %'url'

input.options: Presentation mode Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph), thisObj = this; if (tf != !!tf) return; try{ ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Presentation mode': if (tf != ide.isAppMode) ide.toggleAppMode(); break; case 'Retina display support': if (tf != isRetinaEnabled()) ide.toggleRetina(); break; case 'Long form input dialog': if (tf != InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded) ide.toggleLongFormInputDialog(); break; case 'Plain prototype labels': if (tf != BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel) ide.togglePlainPrototypeLabels(); break; case 'Input sliders': MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput = tf; break; case 'Execute on slider change': ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit = tf; break; case 'Clicking sound': if (tf != !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound) BlockMorph.prototype.toggleSnapSound(); break; case 'Turbo mode': if (tf != stage.isFastTracked) ide.toggleFastTracking(); break; case 'Flat design': if (tf == MorphicPreferences.isFlat) break; if (tf) ide.flatDesign(); else ide.defaultDesign(); break; case 'Keyboard editing': if (tf != (world.keyboardReceiver instanceof ScriptFocusMorph)) { thisObj.scripts.toggleKeyboardEntry(); }; break; case 'Visible stepping': if (tf != Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping) ide.toggleSingleStepping(); break; case 'Thread safe scripts': stage.isThreadSafe = tf; break; case 'Prefer smooth animations': if (tf != (StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0)) ide.toggleVariableFrameRate(); break; case 'Flat line ends': SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds = tf; break; case 'Codification support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping) { StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; case 'Inheritance support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance) { StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; }; } finally { ide.savingPreferences = false; };

input.options: Project notes Project name Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); try { ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Project notes': ide.projectNotes = value; break; case 'Project name': ide.setProjectName(value); break; case 'Language': ide.setLanguage(value); break; case 'Zoom blocks': if (!isNaN(value)) ide.setBlocksScale(Math.min(value, 12)); break; case 'Stage size': if ((value instanceof List) && value.length()==2 && !isNaN(value.at(1)) && !isNaN(value.at(2))) ide.setStageExtent(new Point(value.at(1), value.at(2))); break; case 'Stage scale': ide.toggleStageSize(value != 1, Math.max(0.1, value)); break; case 'Visible palette': ide.currentCategory = value.toLowerCase(); ide.categories.children.forEach(function (each) { each.refresh(); }); ide.refreshPalette(true); break; }; } finally {ide.savingPreferences = true; };

block-definition.comment: This reports a list of poses captured by the camera. There are 'pose property' reporters for inspecting the values in a pose.

block-definition.s: pose property %'property name' of %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

custom-block.s: extract pose property %n from %l using stage coordinates %b

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: location confidence
left right the a
eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

custom-block.s: pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b
pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b
pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.
Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.

custom-block.s: extract pose property %n from %l using stage coordinates %b

block-definition.s: extract pose property %'property number' from %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'

block.comment: Confidence that there is a person at all.
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from minimum and maximum stage x and y.
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

block-definition.s: Add costume number %'costume number' $nl to the training with label %'label' $nl then %'process response' with the response
block-definition.comment: Adds a costume of the current sprite to the training set of 'label'. Before calling this the 'Train using camera ..." block needs to be run to specify the list of labels and start up the training tab.
Send all the costumes of this sprite off to the training tab with the specified label.

custom-block.s: Add costume number %n %br to the training with label %txt %br then %cmdRing with the response

block-definition.comment: Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.
Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.s: Setup camera %'width' %'height' then when ready %'do when camera is ready'
block-definition.comment: Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.

input.options: Project notes Project name User Presentation mode Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); switch (which) { case 'Project notes': return ide.projectNotes; case 'Project name': return ide.projectName; case 'User': return ide.cloud.username; case 'Presentation mode': return ide.isAppMode; case 'Language': return SnapTranslator.language; case 'Zoom blocks': return SyntaxElementMorph.prototype.scale; case 'Stage size': return new List([StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.x, StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.y]); case 'Stage scale': return stage.scale; case 'Retina display support': return isRetinaEnabled(); case 'Long form input dialog': return InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded; case 'Plain prototype labels': return BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel; case 'Input sliders': return MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput; case 'Execute on slider change': return ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit; case 'Clicking sound': return !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound; case 'Turbo mode': return stage.isFastTracked; case 'Flat design': return MorphicPreferences.isFlat; case 'Keyboard editing': return world.keyboardReceiver instanceof ScriptFocusMorph; case 'Visible stepping': return Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping; case 'Thread safe scripts': return stage.isThreadSafe; case 'Prefer smooth animations': return StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0; case 'Flat line ends': return SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds; case 'Codification support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping; case 'Inheritance support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance; default: return which; case 'Visible palette': return ide.currentCategory; }

custom-block.comment: Check if already ready to avoid the 1 second wait

block.comment: Wait a bit more because otherwise a black image is captured.

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

block-definition.s: Create costume in style %'Which style' from %'costume' $nl then %'receive new costume'
block-definition.comment: Applies the selected style to the indicated custome number and adds the new costume this sprite.

input.options: Katsushika Hokusai's Wave Francis Picabia's Udnie Pablo Picasso's La Muse Mathura Style Leonid Afremov's Rain Princess Edvard Munch's Scream Théodore Géricault's Raft of the Medusa Roberto Matta

block-definition.s: all words in language %'language' with features
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words that have a list of features accessible via the "features of" reporter block. Data obtained from https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.s: closest word to %'features' $nl in language %'language' $nl not including %'exceptions' $nl and do as words are found %'when word found' $nl with distance measure %'distance measure'
block-definition.comment: Reports the word that is closest to the features. Uses a distance measure which can be either Eucliean Distance or Cosine similarity. You can choose from among 15 languages or leave it blank for the default language. Optionally one can "watch" it search by adding blocks to the "when word found" slot. The block is passed the best word so far, its distance, and the number of words considered so far.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.comment: Reports a location of a word embedding use t-SNE. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-distributed_stochastic_neighbor_embedding

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block.comment: Convert from 0 to 1 coordinates to Snap! coordinations.

block-definition.s: set pen color to r: %'r' g: %'g' b: %'b'
set pen color to h: %'h' s: %'s' v: %'v'

block.l: var col = new Color(); col.set_hsv(h, s, v); this.setColor(col);

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to analyse costume %'costume' then %'receive response'
block-definition.comment: Sends the pixels of the costume to one of the vision recognition service providers and then runs the provided blocks with the respnse.

input.options: Google Microsoft IBM Watson

block-definition.s: Add costume %'costume' $nl to the training with label %'label' $nl then %'process response' with the response
block-definition.comment: Adds the costume to the training set of 'label'. Before calling this the 'Train using camera ..." block needs to be run to specify the list of labels and start up the training tab.

input.options: Google Microsoft Watson

block-definition.comment: reports the sprite's actual current costume, which may or may not be part of its wardrobe e.g. if it is a copy

block-definition.s: Analyse costume %'costume' then $nl %'process response' $nl with the list of label confidences

custom-block.s: Analyse costume %obj then %br %cmdRing %br with the list of label confidences
Analyse costume %obj then %br %cmdRing %br with the list of label confidences

block-definition.s: display word %'word' in language %'language' with size %'size' and zoom by %'zoom'
block-definition.comment: Displays the word near similar words.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Swedish

block.comment: Attempt to center the word. 12/2 would be correct if every character was full width.

custom-block.s: set pen color to h: %n s: %n v: %n

block.comment: Display the word centered at the location.

custom-block.s: set pen color to h: %n s: %n v: %n

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of poses. Use 'pose property' to get the locations of body parts and the confidences that the locations are correct.

block-definition.s: load camera training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads saved training from the URL.

block-definition.s: load camera training data from file then %'after loading training data'
%'top n' labels for costume %'costume' %'receive labels' with the labels %'receive probabilities' with the probabilities
block-definition.comment: Uses the MobileNet deep learning image recognition model inside your brower. Nothing is sent to the cloud. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.
Reports the 'top n' labels for the costume. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block-definition.comment: Reports the probabilities (or confidences) that the labels for the costume are correct.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block.comment: Change to percentages with 3 digits accuracy.

block-definition.s: weather in %'place' select %'element' in %'units' units $nl then receive response %'do with response' $nl or if an error %'do if error'
block-definition.comment: Passes the response from Yahoo! weather for the place and specified aspect and units to 'do with response' unless there is an error then 'do if error' is run with a description of the error. Documentation at https://developer.yahoo.com/weather/documentation.html

input.options: forecast condition atmosphere wind location description astronomy latitude longitude everything

block-definition.comment: Reports an aspect of the weather at the 'place'. Brought to you by Yahoo! weather. Documentation at https://developer.yahoo.com/weather/documentation.html

input.options:
forecast condition atmosphere wind location
astronomy latitude longitude everything

custom-block.s: weather in %txt select %txt in %txt units %br then receive response %cs %br or if an error %cs

block-definition.comment: If the blocks can be translated to an Arduino sketch they are and sent to the ArduioBot server located at raspberrypi.local:1884. For more information visit https://github.com/ecraft2learn/arduinobot

block-definition.s: get costume features of %'costume' then %'receive features'
sort features %'features' of costumes %'costumes' by distance measure %'distance measure' to %'target features'
block-definition.comment: Creates a sorted list whose elements are a list of the distance to the target, the costume, and the costume features.

custom-block.s: map %repRing on each element of %l and %l

block-definition.s: map %'function' across each item in %'data lists'
block-definition.comment: Apples function to corresponding items in the 'data lists'.

block-definition.s: Euclidean distance between %'point 1' and %'point 2' using JavaScript
block-definition.comment: Reports the distance between the points. Works with any dimensions from 1 to what fits in memory.

block-definition.s: Is model %'model name' ready for prediction?

Create a neural net model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural networkd with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input:
Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent
Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error

block-definition.comment: As it recognises what is spoken it passes the list of label confidences to the 'process confidences' input. If model is "Pre-trained model of 20 words" then it will recognise 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'go', 'stop', 'yes', and 'no', Alternatively if model is "User-trained model" then the model trained by running the "Train with audio buckets" block will be used. Use the 'stop listening for audio label confidences' block to stop this.

inputs.input: User-trained modelPre-trained model of 20 words User-trained model

block-definition.s: Stop listening for audio label confidences
block-definition.comment: If the "Audio label confidences" block is running this stops it.

block-definition.s: Train (without tensorflow) audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: A low-tech version of the "Train with audio buckets" block that should run on small computers such as a Raspberry Pi. Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap! Use the "Audio labels confidences (without tensorflow)" block to obtain recognition confidences.

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block where the saved training has been copied to a web server.

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from file then %'after loading training data'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block . It prompts for the file.

block-definition.s: Train with image buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: This will launch a training window where you can show the system examples of each of the labels in 'bucket names'. If 'add to previous training' is false then training will start over from scratch. Optionally you can provide HTML that will appear instead of the default on the training tab. Finally one can provide commands that will run when the user returns to Snap! from the training panel.

custom-block.comment: When panel is ready then wait for the user to return making the panel hidden.

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is ready to answer queries from Snap!.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' perform %'number of experiments' experiments with each running %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment and after 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available.

block-definition.s: get parameter %'key' from %'list of lists of keys and values'
block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the first key-value pair whose key matches. Reports false if there is no match.

block.var: list of lists of keys and values

block-definition.s: Create and train a neural net named %'model name' based upon %'hyperparameters' then %'do when finished' but if there is an error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: When 'hyperparameters' input is passed in it will create and train 'model name' based on those parameters. Typically the hyperparameters will be created by the "Search for good neural net model parameters ..." block. When the model has been trained this will run "do when finished".

custom-block.s: Create a neural net named %txt based upon %l then %cmdRing but if there is an error %cmdRing
Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Get prediction from model %'name' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once.

block-definition.s: Load neural net from URL %'URL' $nl then when loaded %'do when loaded' $nl unless there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads a model previously saved using the interface on the 'tensorflow.js' page which can be opened using the 'Open support panel ...' block.

block-definition.s: Load %'kind of data' data from URL %'URL' $nl and add to any previous data %'add to previous data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then %'do when data loaded' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads training or validataion data previously saved using the "tensorflow.js" page opened using the "Open support panel ..." block.
Reports a list of 'n' between 1 and 'maximum'. Multiplying and dividing by 1000 produces numbers with 3 decimal places.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Get predictions from model %'name' with inputs %'inputs' $nl then %'process predictions' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to make predictions for each value in 'inputs'
Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'model name' %'n' times $nl then when completed %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. There is a full-featured version of this block.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Alternatively displays or hiides the palette.

block.l: let ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (ide.paletteWidth > 0) { ide.setPaletteWidth(0); } else { ide.setPaletteWidth(200); }

block-definition.s: Run %'number of optimizations' optimization cycles $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl with initial number of training cycles %'epochs' $nl with best results so far %'best parameters so far' $nl for %'model name'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt perform %n experiments with each running %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
Create and train a neural net named %txt based upon %l then %cmdRing but if there is an error %cmdRing
Run %n optimization cycles %br perform %n experiments %br with initial number of training cycles %n %br with best results so far %l %br for %txt

custom-block.l: Error creating model based on best results.

custom-block.comment: This will do 10 searches to find parameters that reduces prediction errors the most.

block-definition.s: Make predictions from history %'best parameters' starting with %'index'

custom-block.s: Create and train a neural net named %txt based upon %l then %cmdRing but if there is an error %cmdRing
Get predictions from model %txt with inputs %l %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
Make predictions from history %s starting with %n

custom-block.comment: Experiment with how well this does predictions after diffferent searches for good hyperparameters.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.
Reports a costume using the camera.

block-definition.s: Create custoume from camera %'mirrored' and pass it to %'process costume'
block-definition.comment: Creates a costume from the video camera and passes it the 'process costume' blocks.

block-definition.s: closest word to %'features' $nl in language %'language' $nl not including %'exceptions'
block-definition.comment: Reports the word that is closest to the features. You can choose from among 15 languages or leave it blank for the default language. There is a full-featured version of this block as well.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

block-definition.comment: Reports the 'n' closest words to the 'features' in 'language'.

block-definition.s: Load words to features in language %'language' then %'do when loaded' $nl use this URL instead of default %'url'

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Portuguese Sinhalese Swedish

block-definition.comment: 'message' will be printed on the browser's console.
Reports a measure of how close 'word' is to pleasant terms versus unpleasant terms.

block.comment: Distance is computed using cosine similarity where 1 is the cloest.

custom-block.comment: Insert this before 'report' to get a record how the calculations.

block-definition.comment: Reports a measure of how close 'word' is to male terms versus female terms.

custom-block.comment: Distance is computed using cosine similarity where 1 is the cloest.
Insert this before 'report' to get a record how the calculations.

block-definition.s: closest words to %'features' in language %'language' $nl and include distances %'include distances'
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words sorted by closeness to 'features'. Optionally can report pairs of words and distances. Distances are measured using cosine similarity.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: closest words to %l in language %txt %br and include distances %b %br do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.s: closest words to %'features' in language %'language' $nl and include distances %'include distances' $nl do with result %'process result'

input.options: record_callbacks(finished_callback);

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' (expert version) $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with activation function %'activation function' $nl with dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural network with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. The 'activation function' is applied after the weighted inputs are summed. 'dropout rate' adds some noise to training that helps prevent overfitting to the training data. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input:
Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent
Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error
reluelu hardSigmoid linear relu relu6 selu sigmoid softmax softplus softsign tanh

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'model name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl with input size %'input size' then %'do when created'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data. There is another version of this block with more inputs.

custom-block.s: Create a neural network model %txt %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with input size %s %br then %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Create a neural network model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input:
Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent
Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Distance Compute Weighted Loss Cosine Distance Hinge Loss Huber Loss Log Loss Mean Squared Error Sigmoid Cross Entropy Softmax Cross Entropy

block-definition.s: Create a neural net named %'model name' based upon %'hyperparameters' then %'do when finished' but if there is an error %'handle error'

custom-block.s: Create a neural network model %txt %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with input size %s %br then %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
